title: You must find a way to activate self-learning, or you have no future

sentences.text: You must find a way to activate self-learning, or you have no future;
[你一定要想办法启动自学，否则你没有未来；]
Treat self-learning as a craft, honing it through persistent practice over time;
[你把自学当作一门手艺，长期反复磨练它；]
You understand the differences between the stages of learning, practicing, applying, and creating, along with tailored strategies for each;
[你懂得学、练、用、造各个阶段之间的不同，以及针对每个阶段的对应策略；]
In a world drowning in 'premature references,' you have your own ways to cope;
[面对“过早引用”过多的世界，你有你的应对方式；]
You know how to 'gulp things down without chewing,' to 'repeat, repeat, and repeat again,' deeply grasping that 'repeated reading brings understanding';
[你会“囫囵吞枣”，你会“重复重复再重复”，你深刻理解“读书百遍其义自见”；]
One of your greatest skills will be deconstructing, deconstructing, and deconstructing further;
[以后你最擅长的技能之一就是拆解拆解再拆解；]
You use your deconstruction craft to break down every challenge into manageable tasks;
[你用你的拆解手艺把所有遇到的难点都拆解成能搞定的小任务；]
Before learning any skill, you never ask 'what's the use?
'—instead, you know that once mastered, you’ll use it daily, inevitably;
[自学任何一门手艺之前你都不会去问“有什么用”，而是清楚地知道，无论是什么只要学会了就只能也必然天天去用；]
You harbor no illusions of urgency, no illusions about time, no illusions of difficulty—you simply stay clearer-eyed than most;
[你没有刚需幻觉，你也没有时间幻觉，你更没有困难幻觉，反正你就是相对更清醒；]
When acquiring any new skill, you know mastery is certain with time, as excellence in any craft depends only on sufficient investment;
[不管你新学什么手艺，你都知道只要假以时日你就肯定能做好，因为所有的手艺精湛，靠的只不过是充足的预算；]
You know how to avoid wasting life: if you’re not deliberately practicing or deliberately thinking, you’re just killing time;
[你知道如何不浪费生命，因为只要不是在刻意练习、不是在刻意思考，那就是在“混时间”；]
You constantly ponder what new creations you can build;
[你总是在琢磨你能做个什么新作品；]
You intentionally use your creations as tools for meaningful connections and filters for trivial ones;
[你刻意地使用你的作品作为有效社交工具，也用作品去过滤无效社交；]
You love sharing, reading, and writing even more—because you seek to repay the world for how it has helped you;
[你乐于分享，乐于阅读也更乐于写作——因为这世界怎么帮助你的，你就想着要怎样回报；]
You treat comprehensiveness and integrity as your highest standards, using them to curb distractions and focus your attention;
[你把全面和完整当作最高衡量标准，也用这个标准去克制、应对自己的注意力漂移；]
You keep learning new skills, understanding the fragility of single talents and the power of combined expertise;
[你会不断自学新的手艺，因为你越来越理解单一技能的脆弱，越来越理解多项技能的综合威力；]
You grow increasingly reliant on the internet—your favorite 'book'—with Google as your best friend, always guiding you to better teachers;
[你越来越依赖互联网，它是你最喜欢的“书”，而Google是你最好的朋友——他总是能帮你找到更好的老师；]
Occasionally, you master skills no one teaches, no one mentors, with no books to reference.
Others call you 'intuitive,' but you know the truth behind it;
[偶尔，你会学会没人教、没人带、甚至没书可参考的手艺，别人都说你“悟性”高，可你自己清楚地知道那其实是怎么回事；]
You increasingly realize there are no 'secrets'—the simpler, more fundamental principles deserve the most respect;
[你越来越明白，其实没什么“秘密”，越简单、越朴素的道理越值得重视；]
You spend more time thinking—or rather, *pondering*—because you’ve mastered the art of focusing on what truly matters.
[你发现你用来思考的时间越来越多——准确地讲，是“琢磨”……只不过是因为你真会琢磨了——你很清楚你应该花时间琢磨的是什么。]
